_exec_summary.SummaryText:
FACILITY ACCIDENTAL RELEASE AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICY.

     THE MANAGEMENT AND EMPLOYEES OF SOUTH CENTRAL FS, INC. ARE COMMITTED TO THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASED OF ANHYDROUS AND AMMONIA.  IF AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR, THE FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT, THE LOCAL EMERGENCY PLANNING COMMITTEE OR OTHER AUTHORITIES, TO MITIGATE ANY RELEASE AND MINIMIZE THE IMIPACT OF THE RELEASE TO PEOPLE AND THE ENVIROMENTAL.



THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED.

     THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THE FACILITY, WHICH IS LOCATED AT RT 40,  IS THE STORAGE AND BLENDING OF FERTILIZERS FOR SALE TO FARMERS.  ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS RECEIVED, STORED, AND DISTRIBUTED FOR DIRECT APPLICATION AS A CROP PRODUCTION NUTRIENT.  THE STORAGE AND HANDLING SYSTEM CONSISTS OF 30,000 GALLON STORAGE TANK, LOADING RISERS, ASSOCIATED PLUMBING AND NURSE TANKS.   ACCESS TO THE SITE IS RESTRICTED TO AUTHORIZED FACILITY EMPLOYEES, AUTHORIZED MANAGEMENT PERSONNEL AND AUTHORIZED CONTRACTORS.









THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASED PREVENTION PROGRAM.

     THIS FACILITY COMPLIES WITH EPA'S ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION RULE AND WITH ALL APPICABLE STATE CODES AND REGULATIONS  THIS FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE PROVISIONS OF "SAFETY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, K-61.1", PUBLISHED BY THE AMERICAN NATIONAL STANDARS INSTITUTED, INC. AS ADOPTED BY THE STATE REGULATION AND THE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONS SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA".  COMPLIANCE WITH THESE REGULATIONS AND ON-GOING TRAINING OF OUR EMPLOYEES MAKE UP OUR ACCIDENT RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY.

     THE FOLLOWING IS A LIST OF ACCIDENTAL RELEASES IS THE PAST FIVE YEARS THAT HAVE OCCURRED AT THE FACILITY:NONE TO REPORT

     THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM.

     THE FACILITY HAS:

     - A WRITTEN EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN, IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA STANDARD, 29

CFR 1910.38;

     - PROVIDED STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITY RIGHT-

       TO-KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE III (EPCRA):

    IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY INVOLVING ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, IT IS OUR POLICY TO NOTIFY THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT AND FAYETTE COUNTY ESDA AND REQUEST THAT THEY RESPOND TO THE EMERGENCY.  OUR EMERGENCY ACTION PLANS HAVE BEEN COORDINATED WITH BOTH THE FIRE DEPARTMENT AND LEPC.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY.

     SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ON-GOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY.  PERIODIC EVALUATIONS ARE PERFORMED TO ASSESS THE MAINTENANCE OF SAFE CONDITIONS.  IN (2000) WE PLAN TO DO EXTENSIVE MAINTENANCE AND UPGRADE THE FACILITY TO MEET NEW STATE REGULATIONS FOR THE HANDLING AND STORAGE OF ANDHYROUS AMMONIA.
